ing: 2 (16 ounce) packages fully cooked kielbasa or Polish sausage, cut into 1/4-inch slices
1 (13.25 ounce) can pineapple chunks in heavy syrup
des: "My family makes this recipe all the time.  It is so delicious.  I recommend trying it with the pork kielbasa first because that's how we have always made it.  I like to use turkey kielbasa now though because it is a bit healthier."
ins:
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Place the sliced kielbasa into a 9x13 inch baking dish. In a medium bowl, stir together the cranberry sauce and pineapple chunks. Pour over the kielbasa and stir to coat.
Bake for about 1 hour in the preheated oven or until sauce thickens.
